marklogic.body:
Well, here’s the thing. People say that green house gases, specifically carbon dioxide, causes global warming. They claim that we put that carbon dioxide in the air solely by Burning carbon based fuels.
Well, I have another theory. Our cities have food shipped to them from the farms. The people eat the food and a great deal of the waste goes into the river, estuaries, and the ocean. Now the ocean is the greatest sequester to carbon dioxide on the planet. Most of this carbon dioxide is captured by the ocean in the form of calcium carbonate. We see this in the huge deposits of sedimentary rock we call, lime stone, made by little sea creatures over the ages. However, our oceans have been effected by the huge discharge of sewage into the oceans.
We can see this by looking at the large areas of anoxic zones found around populated area. These zones are also call dead zones. These dead zones are cause by chemicals run from the where algal blooms deplete the oxygen causing hypoxic zones. Within the hypoxic zones anaerobic bacteria changes the water to a stew of acidic sulfides solutions which changes the basic chemistry of the oceans. These changes inhibit the growth of the little critters that sequester the carbon dioxide. We can see this by the general decline in the coral reefs around the world. The oceans aren’t sucking up the carbon dioxide like they should.
And so, the farmers fertilize their farms and it runs into the oceans; the produce is shipped to the cities where people change it to sewage and the rich organic discharge goes into the oceans. Thus we create dead zones killing Off the creatures that sequester the carbon dioxide; the un-sequestered carbon dioxide is then released into the atmosphere causing at least some part of the increase of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere.
There have been huge volcanic eruptions in the past that show healthy oceans can absorb more carbon dioxide than we even put into the atmosphere today through the Burning of carbon based fuels. Unfortunately, we no longer have healthy oceans. I believe the problem is more than just Burning carbon based fuels. If we stop all Burning of fossil fuels today, we’d find that our atmosphere would still have increasing carbon dioxide levels.
Today's air has a higher carbon 14 factor than it should have; fossil fuels should have a low carbon 14 content. This factor may have been cause by other pollution sources or it may be the carbon dioxide in the air is newer than many think.
Whatever you might think, we’re just going to have to find a better way of taking care of our planet.
